appendix.title: AIX Audit Events
appendix.para: This Appendix provides a complete listing of the AFS events that can be audited on AIX file server machines. See Chapter Monitoring and Auditing AFS Performance for instructions on auditing AFS events on AIX file server machines.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Below is a list of the AFS events contained in the file /afs/usr/local/audit/events.sample. Each entry contains information on the event class, the name of the event, the parameters associated with the event, and a description of the event.

Most events have an associated error code that shows the outcome of the event (since each event is recorded after it occurs), an AFSName (the authentication identify of the requesting process), and a host ID (from which the request originated). Many events follow the RPC server entry calls defined in the AFS Programmer's Reference Manual.

Events are classed by functionality (this is AIX specific). Some events possibly fall into one of more of the following classes which are defined by the file /usr/afs/local/config.sample:
A (afsauthent): Authentication and Identification Events
S (afssecurity): Security Events
P (afsprivilege): Privilege Required Events
O (afsobjects): Object Creation and Deletion Events
M (afsattributes): Attribute modification
C (afsprocess): Process Control Events

row.entry: The file "/usr/afs/Audit" has been written to (AIX specific event).
Auditing is on for this server process (recorded on startup of a server).
Auditing is off for this server process (recorded on startup of a server).
Event triggered by an unauthorized user.

note.para: The following audit-specific events indicate an error has occurred while recording the event. Most events have an AFSName associated with them and a host ID. If this information cannot be gathered out of the Rx structure, one of these events is raised.

row.entry: No rx call structure with this event. Cannot get security, AFS ID, or origin of call.
No connection info associated with rx call. Cannot get security, AFS ID, or origin of call.
Security of call is unknown (must be authorized or unauthorized caller).
No AFS ID/name associated with a secure event.
No information about origin (machine) of caller.
Error in audit event parameter (can't record the event parameter).
The volume server has finished. Finish events are rare since the server process is normally aborted.
The volume server has exited. Exit events are rare since the server process is normally aborted.
AFSVolTransCreate - Create transaction for a [volume, partition]
ECode AFSName HostID Trans VolID VolName Type ParentID
AFSVolNukeVolume - Obliterate a volume completely (volume ID).
AFSVolDump - Dump the contents of a volume.
AFSVolSignalRestore - Show intention to call AFSVolRestore.
AFSVolRestore - Recreate a volume from a dump.
ECode AFSName HostID FromTrans Host DestTrans
AFSVolForward - Dump a volume, then restore to a given server and volume.
ECode AFSName HostID Trans Purge NewName NewType NewVolID
AFSVolClone - Clone (and optionally purge) a volume.
AFSVolSetForwarding - Set forwarding information for a moved volume.
AFSVolGetFlags - Get volume flags for a transaction.
AFSVolSetFlags - Set volume flags for a transaction.
AFSVolGetName - Get the volume name associated with a transaction.
AFSVolGetStatus - Get status of a transaction/volume.
ECode AFSName HostID Trans VolName Type ParentId CloneID BackupID
AFSVolSetIdsTypes - Set header information for a volume.
AFSVolSetDate - Set creation date in a volume.
AFSVolListPartitions - Return a list of AFS partitions on a server.
AFSVolListVolumes - Return a list of volumes on a server.
AFSVolXListVolumes - Return a (detailed) list of volumes on a server.
AFSVolListOneVolume - Return header information for a single volume.
AFSVolXListOneVolume - Return (detailed) header information for a single volume.
AFSVolGetNthVolume - Get volume header given its index.
The backup server has finished. Finish events are rare since the server process is normally aborted.
The backup server has exited. Exit events are rare since the server process is normally aborted.
BUDB_makeDumpAppended - Make the dump an appended dump.
BUDB_FinishDump- Notify buserver that dump is finished.
BUDB_UseTape - Create/add a tape entry to a dump.
BUDB_DeleteTape - Remove a tape from the database.
BUDB_FinishTape - Writing to a tape is completed.
BUDB_AddVolume - Add a volume to a particular dump and tape.
BUDB_GetTextVersion - Get the version number for hosts/volume-sets/dump-hierarchy.
BUDB_GetText - Get the information about hosts/volume-sets/dump-hierarchy.
BUDB_SaveText - Overwrite the information about hosts/volume-sets/dump-hierarchy.
BUDB_GetLock - Take a lock for reading/writing text information.
BUDB_FindDump - Find the dump a volume belongs to.
BUDB_GetDumps - Get a list of dumps in the database.
BUDB_FindLastTape - Find last tape, and last volume on tape of a dump.
BUDB_GetTapes - Find a list of tapes based on name or dump ID.
BUDB_GetVolumes - Find a list of volumes based on dump or tape name.
BUDB_DeleteVDP - Delete dumps with given name and dump path.
BUDB_FindClone - Find clone time of volume.
BUDB_FindLatestDump - Find the latest dump a volume belongs to.
BUDB_T_DumpHashTable - Test dump of hash table.
The protection server has finished. Finish events are rare since the server process is normally aborted.
The protection server has exited. Exit events are rare since the server process is normally aborted.
PR_NameToID - Perform one or more name-to-ID translations.
PR_IDToName - Perform one or more ID-to-name translations.
ECode AFSName HostID GroupId Name OwnerId
PR_NewEntry - Create a PDB (Protection DataBase) entry for the given name.
ECode AFSName HostID GroupId Name OwnerId
PR_INewEntry - Create a PDB entry for the given name and ID.
PR_ListEntry - Get the contents of a PDB entry based on its ID.
PR_DumpEntry - Get the contents of a PDB entry based on its offset.
ECode AFSName HostID GroupId NewName NewOwnerId NewId
PR_ChangeEntry - Change an existing PDB entry's ID, name, owner, or a combination.
PR_SetFieldsEntry - Change miscellaneous fields in an existing PDB entry.
PR_Delete - Delete an existing PDB entry.
PR_WhereIsIt - Get the PDB byte offset of the entry for a given ID.
PR_AddToGroup - Add a user to a group.
PR_RemoveFromGroup - Remove a user from a chosen group.
PR_ListMax - Get the largest allocated user and group ID.
PR_SetMax - Set the largest allocated user and group ID.
PR_ListElements - List all IDs associated with a user or group.
PR_GetCPS - Get the CPS (Current Protection Subdomain) for the given ID.
PR_GetCPS2 - Get the CPS for the given id and host.
PR_GetHostCPS - Get the CPS for the given host.
PR_ListOwned - Get all IDs owned by the given ID.
PR_IsAMemberOf - Is a given user ID a member of a specified group?
KAT_GetTicket - An attempt was made to get an AFS ticket for some principal listed in the Authentication Database.
KAT_GetTicket_old - An attempt was made to get an AFS ticket for some principal listed in the Authentication Database.
KAM_SetPassword - Set the password for a user.
KAM_GetPassword - Get the password of a user.
KAM_GetEntry - The RPC made by the kas examine command to get one entry from the Authentication Database (by index entry).
KAM_ListEntry - The RPC made to list one or more entries in the Authentication Database.
KAM_Debug - The RPC that produces a debugging trace for the Authentication Server.
ECode AFSName HostID name instance flags date lifetime maxAssoc
KAM_SetFields - The RPC used by the kas setfields command to manipulate the Authentication Database.
KAM_GetStatus - An RPC used to get statistics on the Authentication Server.
KAM_GetRandomKey - An RPC used to generate a random encryption key.
KAM_Unlock - The RPC used to initiate the kas unlock command.
KAM_LockStatus - The RPC used to determine whether a user's Authentication Database entry is locked.
ECode AFSName HostID name instance cell
An authorized command was issued and allowed because the user had privilege.
ECode AFSName HostID name instance cell
An authorized command was issued and allowed because the system was running in noauth mode.
An authentication attempt was made with a Kerberos client.
ECode name instance cell name instance
An attempt was made to get a Kerberos ticket.
Check was made and some random server is running noauth.
Server is set to run in authenticated mode.
Server is set to run in unauthenticated mode.

sect1.title: File Server and Cache Manager Interface Events

row.entry: RXAFS_FetchACL - Fetch the ACL associated with the given AFS file identifier.
RXAFS_FetchStatus - Fetch the status information for a file system object.
RXAFS_StoreACL - Associate an ACL with the names directory.
RXAFS_StoreStatus - Store status information for the specified file.
RXAFS_Rename - Rename the specified file in the given directory.
RXAFS_SetLock - Set an advisory lock on the given file identifier.
RXAFS_ExtendLock - Extend an advisory lock on a file.
RXAFS_ReleaseLock - Release the advisory lock on a file.
StartRXAFS_FetchData - Begin a request to fetch file data.
StartRXAFS_StoreData - Begin a request to store file data.
RXAFS_BulkStatus - Fetch status information regarding a set of file system objects.
RXAFS_SetVolumeStatus - Set the basic status information for the named volume.
Checking Permission Rights of user - user has permissions.
Set the privileges of a user.
BOZO_Restart - Restart a given process instance.
StartBOZO_GetLog - Pass the IN params when fetching a BOS Server log file.
BOZO_SetStatus - Set process instance status and goal.
BOZO_SetTStatus - Temporarily set process instance status and goal.
BOZO_StartupAll - Start all existing process instances.
BOZO_ShutdownAll - Shut down all process instances.
BOZO_RestartAll - Shut down, then restart all process instances.
BOZO_ReBozo - Shut down, then restart all process instances and the BOS Server itself.
BOZO_ReBozo - Same as AFS_BOS_ReBos but done internally (server restarts).
BOZO_Restart - Restart a given process instance.
BOZO_WaitAll - Wait until all process instances have reached their goals.
BOZO_AddSUser - Add a user to the UserList.
BOZO_DeleteSUser - Delete a user from the UserList.
BOZO_ListSUsers - Get the name of the user in the given position in the UserList file.
BOZO_ListKeys - List information about the key at a given index in the key file.
BOZO_ListKeys - Same as AFS_BOS_LstKey, but unauthorized.
BOZO_AddKey - Add a key to the key file.
BOZO_DeleteKey - Delete the entry for an AFS key.
BOZO_SetNoAuthFlag - Enable or disable authenticated call requirements.
BOZO_SetCellName - Set the name of the cell to which the BOS Server belongs.
BOZO_AddCellHost - Add an entry to the list of database server hosts.
BOZO_DeleteCellHost - Delete an entry from the list of database server hosts.

entry.para: StartBOZO_Install - Pass the IN parameters when installing a server binary.
EndBOZO_Install - Get the OUT parameters when installing a server binary.

row.entry: BOZO_UnInstall - Roll back from a server binary installation.
BOZO_Prune - Throw away old versions of server binaries and core file.
BOZO_Exec - Execute a shell command at the server.
An RPC to stop any process controlled by the BOS Server.
VL_GetNewVolumeId - Generate a new volume ID.
VL_ReplaceEntry - Replace entire contents of VLDB entry.
VL_UpdateEntry - Update contents of VLDB entry.
